object.description: Daniel Tiger’s Neighborhood is based on the legacy of Fred Rogers. Its cast are the children of his original and much-loved Neighborhood of Make-Believe characters. A young Daniel Tiger is joined by his friends O the Owl, Katerina Kittycat, Prince Wednesday, and Miss Elaina. Together, through imagination, creativity and music they learn the key social skills necessary for school and for life.
object.title: Daniel Tiger's Neighborhood
object.short_description: A young Daniel Tiger learns the key social skills necessary for school and for life.

content.description: Daniel is looking around the house for something he can use as a drumstick. He sees a spoon that Margaret is playing with - it's perfect! Daniel takes it from her, and she begins to cry. Dad reminds Daniel that Margaret was using it first. Before you take something away, stop and ask if it's okay! Daniel asks, but Margaret says no. Dad tells Daniel that he can use a whisk as a drumstick instead.
content.short_description: Daniel looks for his missing drumstick.
content.title: Daniel's Drum

content.description: It's snacktime at the Platypus house! Jodi ate all of her carrots, but is still hungry! She sees that Teddy hasn't eaten one of his carrots- so she takes it from his plate. Teddy starts to cry! He doesn't like that Jodi took it without asking. Nana reminds Jodi that before you take something away, stop and ask if it's okay. Jodi asks, but Teddy says no. Nana gives Jodi one of her carrots instead.
content.short_description: When Teddy isn't looking, Jodi takes one of his carrots.
content.title: Jodi Takes a Carrot

content.description: Leo wants to play with Jodi's special stuffie Benji, but doesn't ask before taking him. Nana reminds Jodi that Leo is too little to know how to ask before taking things. Daniel comes up with an idea - what if Leo and Teddy hold Benji while they watch Daniel and Jodi put on a show!
content.short_description: Leo wants to play with Jodi's special stuffie, but doesn't ask before taking him.
content.title: Leo Wants to Play with Benji

content.description: A song about friends and family asking first before they take things from others.  We see Daniel asking Margaret to play with a toy trolley, Leo asking to use Jodi's blue paint, Daniel offering a tambourine to Margaret instead of his drum, Jodi asking Daniel to read his book, and Teddy and Leo sharing a magnifying glass.
content.short_description: A song about friends and family asking first.
content.title: 'Before You Take Something Away' Song

content.description: Sweater Kid Sam visits with a percussionist who shows him how to use a xylophone, a shekere and the timpani.
content.short_description: Sweater Kid Sam visits with a percussionist.
content.title: A Visit with a Percussionist

content.description: O the Owl is reading a book to the class, but Prince Wednesday wants to see the pictures close up - so close, that he takes the book from O's hands. Now O can't read the rest of the story, and the class can't see! Teacher Harriet reminds Prince Wednesday that before you take something away, stop and ask if it's okay. Prince Wednesday returns the book, and O says that he can look after storytime.
content.short_description: O the Owl is reading a book to the class, but Prince Wednesday wants to see it up close.
content.title: Prince Wednesday Learns to Ask First

content.description: Daniel takes some of Miss Elaina's blocks to build a piggy house with O. She's upset. She was using them first! Teacher Harriet reminds Daniel that even though he wants the blocks too, before you take something away, stop and ask if it's okay. When Daniel does ask, Miss Elaina won't let him take the blocks to build his house - but maybe he can find something else to use!
content.short_description: Daniel takes some of Miss Elaina's blocks without asking.
content.title: Daniel Takes Without Asking

content.description: Daniel, O the Owl and Katerina are playing piggies! Katerina asks to borrow the piggy nose that Tigey is wearing before she takes it. Daniel gives her his piggy ears instead, and then dresses up as a baby wolf! O makes pretend spaghetti sandwiches for everyone - including Tigey, who remembers to ask first before taking more spaghetti.
content.short_description: Daniel, O the Owl and Katerina show that they know how to ask first.
content.title: Piggy Pretending

content.description: Daniel and Dad built an obstacle course in their living room! Daniel wants Margaret to play with him. They are having lots of fun until Daniel starts to rush Margaret through the course - he's moving too fast and Margaret falls. Dad reminds Daniel that sometimes you need to play in a gentle way.
content.short_description: Daniel and Margaret wear PJs and play on an obstacle course in their living room
content.title: Daniel Plays Rough with Margaret

content.description: Daniel imagines that he and Margaret are playing in an obstacle course in the clouds! They bounce through the clouds, row in a cloud-boat, and do the backstroke through the sky!
content.short_description: Daniel imagines that he and Margaret are playing in the clouds.
content.title: Daniel Plays in the Clouds: Imagination Moment

content.description: Daniel is playing too loudly on the obstacle course. Margaret covers her ears, and Daniel reminds himself that he needs to play gently (and quietly) with Margaret. Margaret finds Daniel's toy trolley and Tigey. She throws Tigey to the ground and bangs trolley on the floor, upsetting Daniel. Dad reminds Daniel that Margaret is little, and needs help being gentle. Together, they show her how.
content.short_description: Margaret plays too roughly with Tigey and a toy trolley.
content.title: Margaret Learns to be Gentle

content.description: Daniel is pretending to be a slow turtle, and Katerina wants to be a wiggly octopus! She holds Daniel and Prince Wednesday's hands and moves her arms fast back and forth. Daniel doesn't like this - his friends are being too rough and loud! Teacher Harriet reminds Katerina and Prince Wednesday that sometimes you need to play in a gentle way. Today, Daniel is being a slow turtle, and that's ok.
content.short_description: Daniel wants to pretend to be a slow turtle, but his friends are playing too fast.
content.title: Daniel Pretends to be a Turtle

content.description: It's time to do classroom jobs, and Daniel and Miss Elaina are in charge of feeding Snowball. They get some lettuce and wave it in front of Snowball, speaking loudly. They wonder why Snowball won't eat. Teacher Harriet sees this, and encourages them to speak softly to Snowball so that he won't be afraid. Soon, he's happily eating out of their hands.
content.short_description: Daniel and Miss Elaina learn how to feed Snowball gently.
content.title: Being Gentle with Snowball

content.description: Daniel and his friends sing about playing gently. O pets snowball softly. Miss Elaina makes an art project. Some of the friends make a blocktower too quickly, and it falls over. They rebuild it carefully and it stays standing. Katerina runs toward some birds, and they fly away. She approches slowly, and they stay still as she watches them.
content.short_description: A song about gentle activities.
content.title: 'Sometimes You Need to Play in a Gentle Way' Song

content.description: Daniel is getting ready to go to the dentist for the first time! Mom and Daniel sing a song about brushing teeth. When they get on Trolley, Daniel is a little nervous. Mom reminds him that 'when we do something new, let's talk about what we'll do'! She tells Daniel that Dr. Plat is going to look in his mouth to make sure his teeth are healthy. He'll need to open his mouth and do a quiet roar.
content.short_description: Daniel gets ready to go to the dentist for the first time.
content.title: Daniel Does a Quiet Roar

content.description: Daniel arrives at the dentist with his mom. Dr Plat gives him some toy tools that he can use to pretend to clean the teeth of a stuffed dinosaur. When she takes him back to the exam room, Dr. Plat explains what she's going to do - from brushing Daniel's teeth, to looking inside with a little mirror, to using a special spinning toothbrush that cleans the plaque off teeth.
content.short_description: Daniel arrives at the dentist. Dr. Plat explains how she is going to clean his teeth.
content.title: Daniel Gets His Teeth Cleaned

content.description: Dr Platt sings about all the things dentists do to help make sure you have a healthy mouth.
content.short_description: A song about how dentists are there to help make sure you have a healthy mouth.
content.title: Dentists Are There to Help Song

content.description: A real kid named Sam goes to the dentist.
content.short_description: A real kid named Sam goes to the dentist.
content.title: Dentist Interstitial

content.description: Daniel notices that his hair has grown really long! Dad tells him that he needs a haircut. Dad shows Daniel what cutting hair is like on a funny face that Daniel made. He tells Daniel that Nana Platypus next door can cut his hair - she's a hairdresser! Inside the Playtpus house, Prince Tuesday is getting his hair cut. He reassures Daniel that it doesn't hurt!
content.short_description: Daniel notices that his hair has grown really long!
content.title: Daniel's Long Hair

content.description: Daniel isn't ready to get his hair cut yet! He watches as Nana brushes Miss Elaina's hair into sections, puts colorful bobbles into her hair, and braids the strands with two hands. Daniel imagines that he's in a hairsalon with barber shop quartet-singing hair tools! When he's done imagining, Daniel sees that Miss Elaina's braids are done - she loves her hair!
content.short_description: Daniel isn't ready for his haircut yet, so he watches as Nana braids Miss Elaina's hair.
content.title: Miss Elaina Gets her Hair Braided

content.description: Daniel is finally ready to get his first haircut! Nana reminds Daniel that she'll tell him everything she does before she does it. She raises his chair up high, then puts a cape on him. Nana sprays his hair with water so it's easier to cut. Then she combs and cuts. Daniel thinks about his friends taking care of their hair. Back in the barbershop, Daniel looks in the mirror - he loves his haircut!
content.short_description: Daniel is finally ready to get his hair cut!
content.title: Nana Cuts Daniel's Hair

content.description: Music Man Stan makes bowling pins out of empty bottles and rice - but tells us that we can make them from anything we have at home. He uses a ball and knocks some of the pins down! Miss Elaina arrives and take a turn of her own. She knocks three pins over! Music Man Stan and Miss Elaina love to play games together.
content.short_description: Music Man Stan plays a homemade bowling game.
content.title: Music Man Stan's Bowling Game

content.description: It's bedtime for Katerina Kittycat! Instead of her mom reading a book to her, she decides to tell her mom a story. Katerina shows her mom a book she made herself about a kitty cat family just like Katerina and her mom!
content.short_description: It's Katerina's bedtime! She reads a bedtime book to her mom.
content.title: Katerina's Bedtime Book

content.description: Daniel has made a Tigertastic car! He wants to race with Prince Wednesday, but Prince Wednesday is playing with Jodi. Daniel is upset that Prince Wednesday doesn't want to play with him. He wonders if they are still friends. Teacher Hariett reminds Daniel that even when friends play with someone new, they will still be friends with you.
content.short_description: Prince Wednesday plays with Jodi instead of Daniel.
content.title: Prince Wednesday is Still Daniel's Friend

content.description: Daniel and Jodi are playing moving! O comes over and asks Daniel if he wants to read a book about trains. Daniel says no - he's playing with Jodi. O doesn't understand. Daniel likes trains, and his book is about trains. Is Daniel not his friend anymore? Daniel tells O that they are still friends - even when friends play with someone new, they will still be friends with you.
content.short_description: O wants to read a book with Daniel, but Daniel is playing with Jodi.
content.title: O Wants to Read with Daniel

content.description: We see Daniel and his friends playing in different groups. Jodi and Prince Wednesday don't want to play racecar with Daniel. Daniel plays alone until they join him. Miss Elaina and Daniel play checkers. Jodi wants them to play with her and her stuffed animal. They say no thank you. Even when friends play with someone new, they will still be friends with you.
content.short_description: A song about friends playing with new people.
content.title: 'Even When Friends Play with Someone New' Song

content.description: Daniel and Miss Elaina are playing splat ball. When Jodi arrives, they offer to teach her to play. The three of them are having so much fun!  But then, Miss Elaina gets carried away and forgets to pass to Daniel. Daniel wonders if Miss Elaina doesn't wants to be his friend anymore. Lady Elaine reminds Daniel that even when friends play with someone new, they will still be friends with you.
content.short_description: Daniel feels left out when Miss Elaina throws the ball to Jodi instead of him.
content.title: Daniel Plays with Jodi and Miss Elaina

content.description: Daniel imagines that he's playing splatball on a big court. Tigey, a  teddy bear and a stuffed rabbit play with him as a giant crowd watches. They run up and down the court, making the balls go "splat"!
content.short_description: Daniel imagines that he's playing professional spaltball!
content.title: Splatball!

content.description: Jodi and Daniel are playing polar bears, and Miss Elaina is playing explorers! Daniel decides that being an explorer sounds Tigertastic - he wants to play explorers instead. Jodi feels sad that he doesn't want to play her game. She doesn't think that Daniel wants to be her friend anymore. Daniel reminds her that even when friends play with someone new, they will still be friends with you.
content.short_description: Jodi wants to play polar bears, but Daniel wants to play explorers with Miss Elaina.
content.title: The Polar Bear Explorers

content.description: Baker Aker loves to bake, but he also loves to dance! He invites us inside the bakery to show off his Folklorico dance. He points his toes, snaps, and claps. Anyone can dance - if you can't dance with your feet, you can dance with your hands, or even your eyebrows!
content.short_description: Baker Aker shows off a style of dance called Folklorico.
content.title: Baker Aker's Dance

content.description: It's Jodi's first day at school! This new school doesn't look like her old one. Teacher Harriet tells Jodi that a new school might look different and feel a little strange, but she can look around to find something or someone familiar to help her feel better. Jodi sees...Daniel!
content.short_description: Jodi's new school doesn't look like her old school.
content.title: Welcome to School, Jodi!

content.description: Daniel walks with Jodi as they look for something Jodi knows to help her feel better in this new place.
content.short_description: Daniel helps to welcome Jodi to her new school.
content.title: Daniel is a First Day Friend

content.description: Jodi tries to order pan-pans from Katerina's orange restaurant, but pan-pans aren't orange. Jodi is sad that she doesn't know the rules of this game. She wanders to the book corner instead, and when she looks around for something she knows, she finds a Tigey the Adventure Tiger book!
content.short_description: Jodi doesn't know how to play a game. She finds a book she knows instead!
content.title: Jodi Finds Something She Knows

content.description: It's Carolyn's first day at a new school. Her mom reminds her that she can find something she knows in her classroom to help her feel better. Carolyn plays blocks with a boy named Daniel, and reads some books that look like the ones she has at home.
content.short_description: A real-life girl named Carolyn finds something she knows on her first day at school.
content.title: No Matter Where You Go

content.description: Daniel goes to Jodi's house after school to play! When he gets there, Jodi tells him that at their house, they wear slippers inside instead of shoes. Daniel is unsure about taking off his shoes, but Dr. Plat reminds him that he can find something he knows in this new place.
content.short_description: Daniel goes to Jodi's house after school.
content.title: Daniel's Slippers

content.description: Daniel imagines that he's wearing all kinds of different shoes! He clacks in cowboy boots, dances in ballet slippers, skates in ice skates, taps in tap shoes, and splashes in rainboots!
content.short_description: Daniel imagines he's trying on all kinds of shoes!
content.title: Daniel Tries on Shoes

content.description: Jodi, Leo and Teddy are playing a game called Timber where they knock down blocks with a ball. Daniel isn't sure how to play, but looks for something he knows. He finds a ball that looks like one he has at home. He knows that he likes to throw and catch it! It turns out, Daniel has found the Timber ball!
content.short_description: Jodi and her brothers play a game, but Daniel doesn't know how.
content.title: Daniel Plays Timber

content.description: It's snacktime at Jodi's house! Nana gives Daniel a bowl of fruit. There's a fruit in the bowl that Daniel doesn't know - so Nana encourages him to find a fruit he does know.
content.short_description: Daniel eats an unfamiliar snack at Jodi's house.
content.title: Snacktime at Jodi's House

content.description: We see all of the things that Daniel and Jodi have at their houses that are the same.
content.short_description: A song about all the things Jodi and Daniel have in common.
content.title: "No Matter Where You Go, You Can Find Something You Know"

content.description: Daniel watches a big truck stop in front of the house next to his. Dad Tiger explains that it isn't any ordinary truck...its a moving truck! There must be new neighbors moving in next door! But when Daniel and Dad ring the doorbell, no one answers, and the house looks dark through the window. The neighbors must not be here yet. Daniel wants to go to town to tell everyone about the new neighbors!
content.short_description: A moving truck stops at the house next to Daniel's!
content.title: New Neighbors for Daniel

content.description: Daniel imagines that he lives in an apartment building in a big city, in an igloo in the arctic, on a farm, in a tree house, and even on the moon! Daniel sings that wherever you move, wherever you go, as long as you're with your family you're home.
content.short_description: Daniel imagines that he moves into lots of different houses with his family.
content.title: ''As Long as You're With Your Family You're Home' Song

content.description: Daniel's new neighbor Doctor Plat welcomes his family into her new house. There are boxes everywhere! Doctor Plat looks for her family, who are hiding in the boxes. Two little boys appear - twins named Leo and Teddy! They are fast friends with Margaret - but Daniel doesn't see anyone his age. Maybe there isn't a friend for him here. Just then, the boxes shake, and a girl named Jodi comes out!
content.short_description: Daniel goes inside the Platypus house and looks for new friends.
content.title: Daniel Meets His New Neighbors

content.description: Jodi and her mom unpack Jodi's bedroom. They unroll her carpet, hang pictures on her wall, make her bed, and put away her stuffed animals. It takes time to make a place feel like home.
content.short_description: Jodi and her mom set up Jodi's new room and sing about getting used to a new home.
content.title: 'It Takes Time to Make a Place Feel Like Home' Song

content.description: Jodi and Daniel draw on the inside of their cardboard box tunnel with some of Jodi's crayons. They imagine Jodi's old neighborhood - a colorful house, a main street, a school and a park. They even imagine some of her old friends and neighbors. Jodi wishes she was there - but Daniel tells Jodi he's glad that she's in his neighborhood now.
content.short_description: Daniel and Jodi imagine what Jodi's old neighborhood was like.
content.title: Jodi's Old House

content.description: Jodi's room is all set up. Everything is exactly where it should be... except Jodi's special bedtime book isn't where it always is! Jodi is upset that she can't find her book. Daniel and the Tiger Family volunteer to help look for it. They unpack all the boxes in the house, putting everything in its place. But when they've finished unpacking, they still haven't found the book. Where could it be?
content.short_description: Jodi can't find her special bedtime book, so everyone works together to look for it.
content.title: Jodi's Lost Book

content.description: Daniel asks Jodi about why she doesn't want to go to the party at the Enchanted Garden. She says that everything is different - she misses her old house and she still can't find her book. Daniel and Jodi look in the front yard for the book, and Daniel spots it in a bush! Its a Tigey the Adventure Tiger book - Daniel's favorite! They decide to read it together when they get to the Enchanted Garden.
content.short_description: Daniel and Jodi look outside for Jodi's book.
content.title: Daniel Finds Jodi's Book

content.description: The Platypus Family heads to the Enchanted Garden to meet all of their new neighbors. The neighbors sing them a welcome song but Jodi is still feeling shy. Then, a gust of wind blows some of the loose pages out of Jodi's book, sending them flying into the air! The neighborhood kids chase after them, handing them back to Jodi and introducing themselves.
content.short_description: The Platypus Family heads to the Enchanted Garden to meet the neighbors.
content.title: The Neighborhood Welcomes the Platypus Family

content.description: After a fun evening in the Enchanted Garden, Daniel, Jodi and their families head home. While they ride trolley, they watch fireworks light up the night sky, and wave goodnight to all the neighbors who are at home in their pajamas. Daniel is so happy that he and Jodi are new friends! It takes time to make a place feel like home, but Daniel thinks Jodi and her family are going to like it here.
content.short_description: Daniel and Jodi's families head home on the trolley.
content.title: A Beautiful Night in the Neighborhood

content.description: "Won't You Be Our Neighbor" premieres Monday, September 17th!
content.short_description: "Won't You Be Our Neighbor" premieres Monday, September 17th!
content.title: Come Meet Daniel's New Neighbor!

content.description: "Won't You Be Our Neighbor?" premieres September 17th!
content.short_description: "Won't You Be Our Neighbor?" premieres September 17th!
content.title: There's a New Family Coming to the Land of Make-Believe!

content.description: "Won't You Be Our Neighbor" premieres September 17th.
content.short_description: "Won't You Be Our Neighbor" premieres September 17th.
content.title: Someone New is Joining the Neighborhood!

content.description: Daniel and Baby Margaret play with a toy trolley in Margaret's room. They sing 'the wheels on the Trolley'. Margaret signs that she wants to sing it again.
content.short_description: Daniel and Baby Margaret sing 'the wheels on the Trolley'.
content.title: Baby Margaret's Wheels on the Trolley Song

content.description: "Won't You Be Our Neighbor" premieres September 17th.
content.short_description: "Won't You Be Our Neighbor" premieres September 17th.
content.title: Who is Daniel's new neighbor? Here's a clue!

content.description: Won't You Be Our Neighbor premieres September 17th.
content.short_description: Won't You Be Our Neighbor premieres September 17th.
content.title: Who's Joining the Neighborhood?

content.description: Won't You Be Our Neighbor premieres September 17th!
content.short_description: Won't You Be Our Neighbor premieres September 17th!
content.title: See a sneak peek of Daniel's New Neighbor!

content.description: Teacher Harriet likes to wake up so early in the morning, that the sun isn't up yet. She takes a morning walk and says hello to all the neighbors as they start their days. Teacher Harriet goes to the park to stretch her muscles, and then watches the sun rise.
content.short_description: Teacher Harriet wakes up early - even before the sun is up!
content.title: Teacher Harriet's Morning Stretch

content.description: Cousin Chrissie brushes her horse Peaches to get all the dirt out of her coat. Using a stepstool and Prince Tuesday's help, Chrissie climbs up to ride Peaches.
content.short_description: Cousin Chrissie spends time with her horse Peaches.
content.title: Chrissie's Horseback Ride

content.description: Prince Wednesday is playing soccer in his backyard, but his glasses keep falling off! Good thing he has his glasses strap to keep them on while he's playing.
content.short_description: Prince Wednesday plays soccer, and talks about his glasses.
content.title: Prince Wednesday's Glasses

content.description: Daniel's dad packed him an egg salad sandwich for lunch, and he's so excited to eat it!  When he sits down to eat, Miss Elaina wonders what that smell is. It's Daniel's egg salad sandwich - and Miss Elaina tells him that she doesn't like egg salad. Daniel's feelings are hurt. Teacher Harriet comes over and explains that we like different things, and that's just fine, but remember to be kind.
content.short_description: Daniel has an egg salad sandwich for lunch, but Miss Elaina doesn't like egg salad.
content.title: Daniel's Egg Salad Sandwich

content.description: A montage of our friends eating different foods and being kind to one another. Daniel eats spaghetti while Miss Elaina eats veggies. Prince Wednesday eats chocolate ice cream and Daniel eats vanilla. Miss Elaina holds a pear and Katerina holds an apple. Daniel eats whole peas while Margaret eats mushed peas.
content.short_description: A song about remembering to be kind even if you and your friends like different things.
content.title: "We Like Different Things" Song

content.description: Janae makes a tuna salad sandwich for her school lunch, with the help of her mom.
content.short_description: Janae is making tuna salad sandwich for her lunch.
content.title: Tuna Salad Sandwich Interstitial

content.description: Daniel brought his toy duck named Ducky to the park to play. He shows it to Prince Wednesday, but Prince Wednesday doesn't like Ducky. Daniel's feelings are hurt. Queen Sarah explains that we like different things, and that's just fine, but remember to be kind.
content.short_description: Daniel brings a duck toy to the park, but Prince Wednesday doesn't like it.
content.title: Prince Wednesday Doesn't Like Ducky

content.description: Daniel and Prince Wednesday can't carry all the cool rocks they find in the garden! They put them on Ducky's back so they can show Queen Sarah.
content.short_description: Daniel and Prince Wednesday use Ducky to deliver rocks to Queen Sarah.
content.title: Daniel and Prince Wednesday are Kind

content.description: Daniel plays with his toy duck named Ducky. Ducky has googly eyes and wings that flap. Daniel imagines that he and Tigey are driving in a duck car that looks like Ducky. It can drive on a lake like a boat, and it can even fly!
content.short_description: Daniel plays with his toy duck, and imagines he's driving a duck car.
content.title: Daniel's Duck Car

content.description: Daniel is pretending to make soup, and wants his mom to play with him. But Mom tells Daniel that she can't play because she has to go to work - and she needs Daniel to come with her. Before they go, mom tells Daniel to look around inside the house to find something he can bring along. When grown-ups are too busy to play with you, look around to find something to do!
content.short_description: Daniel wants to play with his mom, but she needs to go to work.
content.title: Daniel Goes to Work with Mom

content.description: While mom is busy working in the Enchanted Garden, Daniel finds something to do while he waits for her to finish. He finds some old boxes, paper, and pool noodles, and builds a rocket ship and a snowman.
content.short_description: While mom works, Daniel makes a rocket ship and a snowman.
content.title: Daniel Makes a Rocket

content.description: Daniel thinks of all the things he and his friends do to stay busy while their grown-ups are working.
content.short_description: We see Daniel and his friends finding things to do while their grown-ups are busy.
content.title: "Look Around and Find Something To Do" Song

content.description: Daniel, Chrissie, and Prince Tuesday want horsey rides from Prince Tuesday, but he can't give them any more because he has to go to work at the grocery store. He tells them that when grown ups are too busy to play, they can look around to find something to do.
content.short_description: Daniel and his friends want horsey rides from Prince Tuesday, but he has to work.
content.title: Daniel Wants a Horsey Ride

content.description: With Prince Tuesday at work, and King Friday planting a tree in the yard, Daniel, Chrissie, and Prince Wednesday keep themselves busy inside. They play a music guessing game and pretend to play on invisible instruments. Then, Daniel imagines what it would be like to be in a One-Tiger Band.
content.short_description: Daniel, Chrissie and Prince Wednesday play a music guessing game to keep themselves busy.
content.title: The Music Guessing Game

content.description: Daniel, Chrissie and Prince Wednesday want King Friday to join their band, but he's busy planting a tree. He reminds them that when grown ups are too busy to play, they can look around to find something to do. Chrissie sees a frog hopping in the garden, and makes up a game called Froggy Freeze. Daniel and Prince Wednesday want to play!
content.short_description: Daniel and his friends make up a game when King Friday is too busy to play with them.
content.title: Froggy Freeze!

content.description: Real kids learn that when grownups are busy, you can play on your own!
content.short_description: Real kids learn that when grownups are busy, you can play on your own!
content.title: Real Kids Look Around and Find Something to Do

content.description: When Nellie the lizard disappears, Daniel and Prince Wednesday decide they need to learn more about her to find where she's hiding. They find a book on lizards, and learn that Nellie can change colors!
content.short_description: Nellie the lizard disappears! Daniel and Prince Wednesday want to find her.
content.title: The Disappearing Lizard

content.description: Daniel and his friends wonder about birds, butterflies, clocks and the stars. They look closely and ask questions. When you wonder, you can try to find out more!
content.short_description: We see Daniel and his friends wondering about birds, butterflies, clocks and more.
content.title: "When You Wonder, You Can Try to Find Out More" Song

content.description: Daniel, Miss Elaina and Dad Tiger are riding Trolley when a puddle of mud gets Trolley dirty! They wonder where Trolley goes to get clean. Trolley takes them to the Trolley wash, where Prince Tuesday and Prince Wednesday wait. Daniel imagines that there's a big machine to wash off Trolley. But all it takes is teamwork to make Trolley sparkling clean again.
content.short_description: Daniel and Miss Elaina wonder how Trolley gets clean.
content.title: Daniel Washes Trolley

content.description: Daniel and his friends wonder where Trolley goes at night. Trolley takes them into town where he parks each night. O, Katerina and Henrietta are there too. They all climb aboard Trolley and finally figure out how many neighbors fit on Trolley at once! Daniel and his friends wonder more about Trolley and think of all the fun things they've done together.
content.short_description: Daniel wonders where Trolley goes at night.
content.title: Daniel Wonders Where Trolley Goes at Night

content.description: Daniel really wants to sit next to Chrissie during circle time, but Miss Elaina sits in the stool next to her before he can. This makes Daniel really mad! He almost hurts Miss Elaina, but Teacher Harriet stops him. Its okay to be angry, but it's never okay to hurt someone.
content.short_description: Daniel wants to sit next to Chrissie, but Miss Elaina gets there first.
content.title: Daniel Wants to Sit Next to Chrissie

content.description: Daniel and Prince Wednesday both want to hop on the hopper ball, but there's only one left. Prince Wednesday is angry, but he stops himself from hurting Daniel.
content.short_description: Daniel and Prince Wednesday both wants to bounce on the hopper ball.
content.title: The Hopper Ball Problem

content.description: We see Daniel and our friends getting angry during circle time, playing with a hopper ball, building a tower with blocks, and playing with toys at dinner. They get angry, but they stop themselves from hurting each other.
content.short_description: We see our friends getting angry but stopping themselves before they hurt someone.
content.title: "Its Okay to Feel Angry but It's Not Okay to Hurt Someone"

content.description: We see real kids getting angry at the playground, building a tower with blocks, and playing with a hopper ball. They get angry, but they stop themselves from hurting someone.
content.short_description: We see real kids getting angry but stopping themselves before they hurt someone.
content.title: Real Kids Learn It's Not Okay to Hurt Someone

content.description: Daniel and Margaret are playing in his room. Daniel builds a block archway, and Margaret tries to crawl through it - but she's too big! The block tower falls over and Daniel gets mad. Mom Tiger stops him before he hurts Margaret, and helps him to understand that it's okay to feel angry but it's not okay to hurt his sister.
content.short_description: Daniel builds a block archway and Margaret knocks it over.
content.title: Daniel Gets Mad at Baby Margaret

content.description: Daniel wants to give his toy animals a bubble bath. While he puts them in the sink with some soap, he imagines that he's giving real animals a bath. Mom Tiger comes in and tells Daniel that he shouldn't be playing with water alone - and it's lunchtime. Daniel wants to wash his toys first but mom tells him no. He gets angry, but stops himself from hurting her.
content.short_description: Daniel gets mad at mom when she tells him to stop playing because it's lunchtime.
content.title: Daniel Stops Himself

content.description: Ryan meets an astronaut and learns what he does.
content.short_description: Ryan meets an astronaut and learns what he does.
content.title: Ryan Meets an Astronaut

content.description: Daniel and mom are going to meet Katerina at the market. Daniel is so excited! He doesn't want to wait to see Katerina, so he doesn't go potty before he and mom leave home. When they get on Trolley, Daniel realizes he does have to go potty! But there's no potty on Trolley, and Daniel and mom have to go back home so Daniel can use the bathroom.
content.short_description: Daniel has to go potty while he's on Trolley.
content.title: Daniel Has to Go Potty

content.description: Daniel and his friends sing about going potty in the morning before they go to school, when they're getting ready to go on a trip, and before they get into bed. This song aims to teach children to go potty even when they're not sure they have to.
content.short_description: Daniel and his friends sing about sitting and trying to go potty.
content.title: "Go Potty, Go" Song

content.description: Daniel and Miss Elaina are playing rocket ship when Daniel's tummy starts to grumble. He calls his mom in, and she says that even if he already went pee, his grumbling tummy might mean he has to go poop. When you have to go potty, stop and go right away.
content.short_description: Daniel's tummy hurts while he's playing with Miss Elaina. Maybe he has to go potty.
content.title: Daniel's Tummy Hurts

content.description: Daniel and Miss Elaina are pretending to be astronauts looking for space rocks! They zoom into Margaret's room, where Mom Tiger is changing her diaper. Daniel and Miss Elaina learn that babies can't take themselves to the bathroom, so they go potty in their diapers.
content.short_description: Daniel and Miss Elaina run into baby Margaret's room, where her diaper is being changed.
content.title: Baby Margaret Has Her Diaper Changed

content.description: Daniel imagines his friends singing a song about going potty. Do you have to go potty? Maybe yes, maybe no. Why don't you sit and try to go?
content.short_description: Daniel and his friends sing about going potty.
content.title: Everyone Goes Potty

content.description: It's a beautiful day in the neighborhood! So beautiful, that Daniel and Dad Tiger decide to walk to the post office instead of taking Trolley. Along the way they pass the park, and Daniel wants to stop and play. But Dad says no - they have to get to the post office before it closes. That makes Daniel mad! He takes a deep breath, and counts to four to calm down.
content.short_description: Daniel wants to play at the playground, but he and dad have to get to the post office.
content.title: Daniel Wants to Stay at the Playground

content.description: Daniel wants to make a puppet, but doesn't know what to make it out of. Then he sees a sock nearby - perfect! He colors eyes, ears, a mouth and a nose on the sock and ta-da, he's got a dog puppet! Daniel loves it, But when Dad Tiger sees it, he's mad that Daniel ruined his sock. He takes a deep breath, and counts to four to calm down.
content.short_description: Daniel makes one of dad's socks into a sock puppet - which makes dad mad!
content.title: Dad Tiger Gets Mad

content.description: Daniel wants to play at the park, but dad says no. Daniel gets mad at Dad and then takes a deep breath to calm down. He gives dad a hug. Prince Tuesday and Prince Wednesday are mad at each other. They take deep breaths to calm down, and then give each other a hug. You can be mad at someone you love, when you are ready, give them a hug!
content.short_description: Daniel and his friends give their families hugs after they've been mad.
content.title: "You Can Be Mad at Someone You Love" Song

content.description: Daniel and Miss Elaina are painting pictures of themselves. They both need the red paint, but Miss Elaina had it first. Then, she accidentally spills paint on Daniel's picture. That makes Daniel mad! He stomps and accidentally rips her picture. Now Miss Elaina is mad too! Teacher Harriet comes over and reminds them that you can be mad at someone you love. When you are ready, give them a hug.
content.short_description: Daniel and Miss Elaina both need the red paint to paint their pictures.
content.title: Daniel's Ruined Picture

content.description: Daniel plays with O and Prince Wednesday on the carpet. O is building a town, and needs the toy trees for a park. Prince Wednesday's dinosaur is going camping, and he needs the trees for his forrest. They both get mad that they can't have the trees for themselves! They take a deep breath and count to four to calm down.
content.short_description: O and Prince Wednesday both need the toy trees while they play.
content.title: O and Prince Wednesday Get Mad

content.description: Daniel remembers moments where he and his friends have been happy, sad, mad and all the feelings in between. There are so many feelings to feel when spending time with each other - but in the end, we know we are friends!
content.short_description: Daniel and his friends explore their feelings and celebrating their friendships.
content.title: "Friends, Friends, Friends, We Are Friends" song

content.description: Daniel is playing castle with his friends at school. They pretend that Prince Wednesday the dragon wants to get into the castle! Everyone chases Prince Wednesday, and Daniel is having fun - until he gets bumped. Everyone is too noisy and running too fast. Teacher Harriet tells Daniel that he doesn't have to play anymore. It's okay that he wants to be alone - he can play later.
content.short_description: Daniel's friends are so noisy! Teacher Harriet tells Daniel it's okay to play alone.
content.title: Daniel Plays By Himself

content.description: O thinks that he can save the castle from Prince Wednesday the dragon - but to find out how, he needs to read his book. O finds some pillows in the book corner where he sits down to read all about a castle and a dragon. When he's finished, he shows his friends the picture of the castle in his book - it has water all around it! That's how they'll keep Prince Wednesday the dragon out!
content.short_description: O can save the castle from the dragon - but he wants to read his book first.
content.title: O Wants to Be Alone

content.description: Daniel and his friends spend time by themselves, drawing, swinging, looking up at the clouds, and reading a book. Sometimes you want to be alone.
content.short_description: Daniel and each of his friends spend time by themselves.
content.title: "Sometimes You Want to Be Alone" Song

content.description: Daniel gets a special delivery in the mail - a book from Grandpere! The book is about Tigey the Adventure Tiger, and Daniel is so excited to read it. But when he, dad and Margaret get inside, Margaret wants Daniel's book too. Her squeaky toy is distracting and she keeps trying to grab the pages. Daniel doesn't like it. Dad thinks that he needs some time to be alone so that he can read his book.
content.short_description: Daniel gets a book in the mail! He wants to read it by himself.
content.title: A Book from Grandpere

content.description: After looking through his new Tigey the Adventure Tiger book, Daniel decides that he wants to draw his own adventure story. He uses some paper and crayons to get started. But Margaret wants to draw too. She scribbles on Daniel's paper. Daniel wants to draw by himself, so he takes his paper to his cozy spot, where he can be by himself. There, he thinks of all the things he can do when he's alone.
content.short_description: Daniel wants to draw his own adventure story - but Margaret keeps drawing on his paper.
content.title: Daniel Draws an Adventure Story

content.description: Daniel finds his fish has died. He's not swimming anymore, he's not moving, and he's just laying on his side.  Mom and Dad Tiger tell Daniel that asking questions about what happened can help. They help him understand that when something dies, it can't play anymore. And that there are things Daniel can do to help himself with his sad feelings.
content.short_description: Daniel finds his fish has died and Dad Tiger helps him with his sad feelings.
content.title: Blue Fish is Dead

content.description: Daniel isn't ready to play with Margaret because he has lots of feelings about his fish dying. But Margaret continues to want to play and Daniel finds that playing helps him feel better. He wonders if it's okay to laugh and play even though his fish has died. He talks about it with his mom and dad who help him know that everyone has sad feelings sometimes and happy feelings sometimes, too.
content.short_description: Daniel isn't ready to play with Margaret. He has lots of feelings about his fish dying.
content.title: Daniel Still Feels Sad

content.description: This song reminds us that everyone feels sad sometimes and there are many things we can do to help us feel better, like talking, hugging, playing and drawing a picture. And it's good to know that the very same people who are sad sometimes are the very same people who are happy sometimes.
content.short_description: When you feel sad, there are lots of things you can do to help yourself feel better.
content.title: "Things to Do When you Feel Sad" song

content.description: Daniel and Katerina discover that the strawberry plants in the Enchanted Garden have died. Mom Tiger helps them understand that when something dies it can't grow anymore, even if they give it more water, it's still dead.
content.short_description: The strawberry plants are dead. Even watering them won't bring them back to life.
content.title: What Happened to the Strawberries?

content.description: Daniel sees a worm in the dirt and makes believe he can go underground with it.  Once he's there he finds a worm dance party with disco lights and singing and dancing through the worm tunnels.
content.short_description: Daniel makes believe he can go underground where there's a worm dance disco party.
content.title: A Make Believe Worm Dance Party

content.description: Daniel and his friends see how it helps to be able to talk openly and honestly about the things they wonder and worry about. Queen Sara helps the children talk about the plants that died, and Mom Tiger helps the children understand that the Mama bird will come back to her nest.
content.short_description: There are lots of things to ask questions about - why plants die, or where mama bird went.
content.title: Where is Mama Bird?

content.description: Daniel, and his friends sing this song about how they can help one another when they feel sad. There's something you can try when you're sad - ask questions about what happened, it might help. It helps to talk about our feelings and ask questions about things we don't understand.
content.short_description: A song about how friends can help if you talk with them about your sad feelings.
content.title: "Ask Questions about what Happened" song

content.description: Daniel is playing house with Tigey, pretending that he is the daddy and Tigey is his little baby. But when Margaret spills orange juice all over Tigey, Daniel gets very upset. Mom helps him know that there are ways he can help himself feel better.  And ways she can help too.
content.short_description: Daniel is upset when Margaret spills juice on Tigey.
content.title: Tigey is So Special to Me

content.description: Daniel and Tigey are both getting cleaned up in the bathroom. As Daniel plays in the bathtub he imagines what it would be like if he and Tigey could be swimming together in a big pool. It's a synchronzed swimming performance with different stuffies.
content.short_description: Daniel and Tigey are getting a bath and Daniel makes believe they are swimming in a pool.
content.title: Daniel and Tigey Take a Bath

content.description: Miss Elaina and Daniel are at the library. Miss Elaina is missing her dad and feeling upset. Daniel helps her know that when she's upset she can help herself feel better. She has a special locket with a picture of her mom and dad and that helps her feel better. What helps you feel better when you're sad or upset?
content.short_description: Miss Elaina misses her dad. Seeing a picture of her dad and mom helps her feel better.
content.title: Miss Elaina's Special Locket

content.description: Abbot is doing something new. He's going to a gymnastics class. He takes his stuffed animal, Duckins, with him. Just knowing that Duckins is there if he needs him, helps Abbot feel braver and stronger.  He tumbles and climbs and when he feels nervous to try a somersault, he gets a hug from his favorite stuffie to help him try again.
content.short_description: Abbot is doing something new. He takes his stuffed animal with him to help him feel better
content.title: Abbot's First Gymnastics Class

content.description: Mom and Dad Tiger leave to go away on a trip and Grandpere is staying with Daniel and Margaret. But Daniel is missing his mom and dad and feeling upset. Grandpere helps Daniel think about the things that help him feel happy when he is upset. Tigey helps Daniel feel better when he misses the people he loves.
content.short_description: Daniel is upset because his mom and dad are going away. Tigey helps him feel better.
content.title: Mom and Dad are Going on a Trip

content.description: Daniel likes taking care of animals. He makes believe he is taking care of real animals, each in their own way. The bunnies who go hop, hop, duckies who go quack, quack and the puppies who he loves to hug.
content.short_description: Daniel makes believe he has lots of real pet animals to take care of and play with.
content.title: Make Believe Pets

content.description: Daniel is at school playing, but Prince Wednesday and Miss Elaina are being noisy and rough and Daniel gets knocked down. He didn't like that!  He remembers what Grandpere told him about finding something that can help him feel better. It's Tigey. He holds Tigey and talks to him about his feelings, and that helps him be able to be ready to play again.
content.short_description: Daniel gets knocked down. He holds his Tigey and that helps him feel ready to play again.
content.title: Do You Ever Feel Upset?

content.description: Everyone has times when they are upset and things aren't going their way. Daniel does too. But he has Tigey to help him feel better -- when he's feeling scared or mad or sad or doing something new, he can hold Tigey tight.  This songs helps children remember there are things that can help them feel better when they are upset.
content.short_description: A song to help when you're feeling upset. Tigey helps Daniel feel better.
content.title: "When You're Upset" Song

content.description: Daniel gets paint on his favorite red sweater - and his blue sweater is in the wash. Today Daniel will have to wear something different. Sometimes it's hard to do things differently than what we expect or planned. He chooses his trolley t-shirt and he likes it too.
content.short_description: Daniel gets paint on his red sweater and he has to find something else to wear today.
content.title: Daniel Can't Wear His Sweater Today

content.description: Daniel makes believe he can make all kind of music with the things in the bakery. There are so many different sounds with the pots and pans,  the wooden spoons, the rolling pin, the whisk, the shakers, and even the milk pouring.
content.short_description: Daniel makes believe he can make all kinds of music with the things in the bakery.
content.title: Make Believe Bakery Music

content.description: Daniel is disappointed when Katerina doesn't feel well and they can't have the special pink picnic they planned. Daniel was looking forward to it all day. It can be hard when things don't work out the way they are planned. Daniel  talks with his dad and they decide they can have a picnic of their own instead.
content.short_description: Daniel is disappointed when Katerina is sick and they can't have the picnic they planned.
content.title: The Pink Picnic Plans Are Cancelled

content.description: Daniel, Prince Wednesday and Katerina sing about some of the things they do the same way everyday - Daniel eats the same breakfast, Prince reads the same story, Katerina has the same snack. But sometimes things change. This song helps children to remember that when things change, they can do things a different way. It can be hard, but this song can help.
content.short_description: A song about being willing to do things a new way, at least for today.
content.title: "Things May Change and That's Okay" song

content.description: Real life neighbors Calli and Donovan are getting ready for a picnic in the park. They are so excited, getting all the toys together and the food ready. But their friend gets sick and their plans have to change. They are so disappointed. Instead of going to the park for their picnic, they have an inside picnic in their living room.
content.short_description: Real life neighbors plan for a picnic, but their plans have to change.
content.title: Calli and Donovan's Picnic is Cancelled

content.description: At school there's a leak in the roof and the children need to have Circle Time in the Block corner. It's square time instead of circle time. And they missed taking Trolley on their Field Trip and will have to walk instead. Sometimes things change from what was planned. It good to remember that things can change and that's okay.
content.short_description: Things don't go as planned today. It can be hard when things are different than usual.
content.title: There's a Leak at School and Plans Change

content.description: This song reminds children that there are so many different times when things don't go as usual, or when plans have to change. Children can find ways to manage - if it's raining outside, if a friend can't play, or if today's snack is different -- and even have fun with the changes. That shows they are growing up.
content.short_description: A song about being able to find new ways when things change.
content.title: "It Feels Good to Say,  a Different Way is Okay" song

content.description: Daniel, Miss Elaina and Prince Wednesday are playing together at school. Miss Elaina wants to pretend to be a firefighter but Prince Wednesday wants her to be an astronaut - like she always is. Teacher Harriet helps the children know that everyone can be more than one thing.
content.short_description: The children play pretend as firefighters and learn that they can be more than one thing.
content.title: Playing Firefighters at School

content.description: Today Trolley is being a fire engine - and Music Man Stan and Dr. Anna are the Neighbohood's volunteer firefighters. They visit the school and help the children learn about what they do.They have special clothes to protect their bodies, Trolley has a special bell to ring to let people know it is going fast, and they use a ladder and hoses when they get to a fire.
content.short_description: Trolley is a fire engine today and Dr. Anna and Music Man Stan are firefighters.
content.title: A Visit with the Neighborhood's Firefighters

content.description: Daniel makes believe that Trolley can be lots of things - a race car, a tow truck, a firetruck and a submarine under the sea.
content.short_description: Daniel makes believe that Trolley is a race car, a tow truck, and a submarine.
content.title: Let's Make Believe Trolley Can be Lots of Things

content.description: Daniel, Music Man Stan and Dr. Anna sing about being more than one thing. Daniel can be an artist painting a picture as well as a singer on a stage. Music Man Stan is a musician - and a daddy, too. And Dr. Anna is a doctor who takes care of people, and sometimes she's a firefighter too.
content.short_description: A song that shows that both children and adults can be more than one thing.
content.title: "You Can Be More than One Thing" Song

content.description: Daniel, Katerina and O the Owl are playing at the Treehouse. Today Daniel wants to pretend to be a Daddy, with his new doll that Grandpere made for him. But Katerina and O are playing superheroes and want him to be Tigey the Adventure Tiger, like he always is. They find a way to play together and learn that at different times they can be different things.
content.short_description: Daniel wants to pretend that he's a dad, not Tigey the Adventure Tiger.
content.title: Playing at the Treehouse

content.description: In this imagination moment, Daniel makes believe that he's taking care of lots of babies - feeding them in their high chairs, playing peek-a-boo with them, and giving them sweet baby hugs.
content.short_description: Daniel makes believe that he's taking care of lots of babies, animals and dolls.
content.title: Make Believe about Lots of Babies

content.description: Daniel sings a song about all the many things he can be to so many people. He's a son, a grandson, a brother, a friend and a neighbor, too!  And when he imagines he can be so many different things -- an adventure tiger, a dad, a sailor, an artist, or a doctor. All the different things that he can be is what makes him Daniel - and he knows can be more than one thing.
content.short_description: A song that celebrates Daniel as a son, a grandson, a brother, a friend and a neighbor.
content.title: "All the Different Things I Can Be" song

content.description: Daniel is wondering what it's like to be King. King Friday tells him he can be King for the day and shows him the royal list of tasks. But what's most important is for a king to be kind. They sing a song about some of the many ways we can choose to be kind to one another - sharing toys, helping when someone's not feeling well, giving hugs, helping with clean up.
content.short_description: Daniel knows what's most important is for a king to be kind.
content.title: "It's Great to Be Kind" Song

content.description: In this Imagination Moment Daniel makes believe there are Kings and Queens everywhere in the forest - - a Rabbit King watching over the bunnies, a friendly queen bee and more-   and that he can play and sing with them.
content.short_description: Daniel makes believe there are animal Kings and Queens everywhere in the forest.
content.title: Kings and Queens Are Everywhere

content.description: King Daniel has tasks to do as King, but when he sees that Prince Tuesday is hurt, he decides that what's most important is to stop and help. And even though Daniel needs something from the bakery, first he chooses to help Baker Aker with his work getting his delivery ready. Mom, Daniel and Baker Aker work and sing together as they pack up all the cookies.
content.short_description: Daniel chooses to be a kind king and helps his neighbors Prince Tuesday and Baker Aker.
content.title: Daniel is Kind to Prince Tuesday and Baker Aker

content.description: Daniel's job is to pick a sweet treat at the Bakery to take to King Friday. But when his friend O the Owl drops his ice cream cone, his special treat,  Daniel chooses a way to be kind. Daniel gives O his sweet treat so that his friend won't be sad. Daniel is learning that there are many ways to be kind.
content.short_description: O drops his ice cream cone and Kind King Daniel helps him feel better.
content.title: O Drops His Ice Cream Cone

content.description: Daniel isn't sure he has done his job being King because he doesn't have the things he was asked to get. But what Daniel did as King  was help others in the Neighborhood of Make Believe and that's what's most important. He found lots of ways to be kind.
content.short_description: A song that shows some of the many ways King Daniel found to be kind to his neighbors.
content.title: "You Can Choose to Be Kind" Song

content.description: Five of the 'sweater kids' show some ways they help their family and friends. Ryann collects blankets for an animal shelter, Jazmyn makes a note for her mom, Gavin helps a neighbor rake leaves, Thomas helps his grandparents with their groceries, and Anisha bakes cookies for a new neighbor. There are so many ways children can choose to be kind in their real neighborhoods.
content.short_description: Real children show some of the ways they help their family and friends.
content.title: The Sweater Kids Help in Their Real Neighborhoods

content.description: Daniel is so exctied to hang up the picture he made for Grandpere that he doesn't take his time to do it right. Dad helps him know that it helps to slow down and be careful. Daniel tries again and this time he slows down and does is carfully.
content.short_description: Daniel is excited to hang up his picture. But he needs to take his time to do it right.
content.title: Daniel Hangs Up His Picture

content.description: Prince Tuesday is so excited to help Daniel and Grandpere that he goes too quickly drops a bag of flour. He remembers it helps to slow down. The flourlooks a little like snow, which leads Daniel to make believe that it's snowing in the grocery store.
content.short_description: The flour spills at the grocery store and Daniel makes believe it's snow.
content.title: Flour at the Grocery Store

content.description: This song reminds children that sometimes it's good to go slow, there's no need to rush - especially when you want to make a gift for someone you love. Miss Elaina makes a necklace, Prince Wednesday makes a thank you card and Daniel makes a picture for his Grandpere.
content.short_description: This song reminds children of the things they can do when they take their time and go slow
content.title: "Take Your Time and Do It Right" Song

content.description: Daniel is so excited to take a nature walk, that he doesn't quite make his nature bag they way he has to. Teacher Harriet helps him know that  we all make mistakes when we're rushing. When we're excited it can be hard to slow down.
content.short_description: Daniel is so excited to take a nature walk that he didn't make his nature bag the right wa
content.title: Daniel's Nature Bag

content.description: Daniel makes believe he is the King of nature in a fantastical nature land. He sings from the top of a tree and glides on a leaf all around. The birds and butterflies all sing with him.
content.short_description: Daniel makes believe he is the king of nature who loves to sing.
content.title: Daniel, King of Nature

content.description: The children are on a nature walk with Teacher Harriet but Miss Elaina is so excited she doesn't go slowly enough to see or hear the bugs and animals. She learns to slow down and has a chance to see the butterfly she was so looking forward to seeing. Sometimes it's good to go slow.
content.short_description: Miss Elaina has a hard time going slowly and listening carefully on the nature walk.
content.title: Go Slow in Nature

content.description: This song celebrates some of the wonderful nature all around that we can see when we slow down and take our time. Daniel watches the ants in an anthill, the children wait for Ducky to hatch, Katerina and Daniel explore the beach, and the Tiger family gazes at the nighttime sky. There's so much to see when you take it slow.
content.short_description: What will you see and find when you slow down and take your time?
content.title: "Sometimes It's Good to Go Slow" Song

content.description: Real neighbor Jazmyn visits the aviary to see some of the different birds there. There are tropical birds and forest birds. There's even a bird that can talk!
content.short_description: Real neighbor Jazmyn visits the aviary to see some of the different birds there.
content.title: A Visit to the Aviary

content.description: It's alright to take a break, and be alone and fine a place of your very own.
content.short_description: It's alright to take a break, and be alone and fine a place of your very own.
content.title: It's Alright To Take a Break

content.description: Jasmine hangs out with Floyd, who shows her how he made all his pictures with an eraser.
content.short_description: Jasmine hangs out with Floyd, who shows her how he made all his pictures with an eraser.
content.title: Jasmine Visit an Artist

content.description: You can be mad at someone you love, but when you're ready, you can give them a hug.
content.short_description: You can be mad at someone you love, but when you're ready, you can give them a hug.
content.title: You Can Be Mad At Someone You Love

content.description: Gavin visit Allison, who makes portraits of people.
content.short_description: Gavin visit Allison, who makes portraits of people.
content.title: Gavin Visits His Artist Friend

content.description: Makenna and her dad make pancakes for breakfast. There's no need to hurry! Sometimes it's good to go slow and take your time.
content.short_description: Sometimes it's good to go slow and take your time to do things.
content.title: Makenna and Her Dad Make Pancakes for Breakfast

content.description: It's time for Daniel to calm down and get ready for sleep. Dad teaches him a song to help "count down to calm down." Then it's time for Daniel to brush his teeth. It can be hard to stop playing even though our bodies need to sleep.
content.short_description: It's time for Daniel to get ready for sleep. Dad has a song to help him calm down.
content.title: Time for Bed

content.description: In this imagination moment Daniel makes believe that Tigey is going to sleep in the jungle. He is surrounded by his jungle friends with fireflies as his night light. Daniel sings him a good night song to assure him that he is safe and sound.
content.short_description: Daniel makes believe that Tigey is in the jungle, going to sleep in his hammock.
content.title: Tigey Sleeps in the Jungle

content.description: A lullaby for Daniel as he lies in bed getting ready for sleep. He's lying in the puffy clouds, sleeping on the moon, counting down, and calming down to get ready for sleep.
content.short_description: A lullaby to help Daniel count down and calm down and be ready for sleep.
content.title: A Daniel Goodnight Song 5-4-3-2-1

content.description: The friends are having a sleepover in a tent in Daniel's living room. Their babysitter, Prince Tuesday, has some ways to help them calm down and get ready to go to sleep. There are glow in the dark stickers and a goodnight song they can each be a part of. Then it's time to go to sleep.
content.short_description: With Prince Tuesday's help, Daniel and Wednesday are calming down to get ready to sleep.
content.title: Camping in the Living Room

content.description: A song that shows Daniel and some of his neighbors calming down and getting ready for sleep. Miss Elaina and her father are singing a song, O and Uncle X are reading a book and King Friday snuggles with Prince Wednesday. Everyone is tucked in and ready to sleep and dream.
content.short_description: It's time for all the neighbors to calm down and get ready for sleep.
content.title: "Count Down to Calm Down" Song

content.description: Daniel's friend learns how to hit a baseball.
content.short_description: Daniel's friend learns how to hit a baseball.
content.title: Daniel's Friend Learns How To Hit a Baseball

content.description: Gavin visits with a magician who teaches her a magic trick. How can she learn how to know what color the crayon is, even when it is behind her back. It seems like magic, but she learns the trick and can do it herself.
content.short_description: Gavin visits with a magician who teaches her a magic trick. What color is the crayon?
content.title: Gavin Learns a Magic Trick

content.description: Dad Tiger gives Daniel a special present - a bicycle that used to be his. Daniel is so excited, but it's harder and different than pedaling his trike. With Dad's encouragement Daniel keeps trying. When he wants to give up because going uphill is too hard, he remembers to grr, grr and keep on trying, and he feels proud.
content.short_description: Daniel is learning to ride a bicycle. Even though it's hard to do, he keeps on trying.
content.title: Daniel's New Bicycle

content.description: At the playground, Prince Wednesday is learning how to use the rings. It's hard to do. With the encouragement of Daniel, Chrissie, and Prince Tuesday, he keeps on trying. He works really hard and gets across all five rings at the playground!
content.short_description: Prince Wednesday keeps on trying and gets across all five rings at the playground.
content.title: The Rings are Hard

content.description: In this imagination moment Daniel makes believe that Tigey can ride a bicycle. Together they ride across the countryside in a pretend bicycle race. They celebrate as they cross the finish line with confetti and balloons.
content.short_description: Daniel makes believe he and Tigey are in a bicycle race, riding across the countryside.
content.title: A Bicycle Race with Tigey

content.description: A song to sing to help children keep on trying, especially when something is new and seems really hard to do. Whether playing catch, tying your shoes, doing a cartwheel or building a snowman - getting better little by little is what it's all about. Keep on trying and you'll feel proud.
content.short_description: A song to help you keep on trying, even when something is new and seems hard to do.
content.title: "Grr, Grr, Grr, Out Loud" Song

content.description: Daniel visits with the neighborhood kids and sings go potty go!
content.short_description: Go Potty Go! Why don't you sit and try to go!
content.title: Go Potty Go!

content.description: Daniel is having so much fun playing and singing with Margaret, he's not sure he wants to play with his friends. He has mixed feelings. He feels happy to play with Katerina and O, but he's sad to stop playing with his sister.
content.short_description: Daniel is having so much fun playing with Margaret, he doesn't want to play with friends.
content.title: The Tiger Family Band

content.description: Daniel makes believe he is so little he can ride a ladybug through the grass. He's on  a make believe safari  in a jungle of tall grass and giant mushrooms.
content.short_description: Daniel makes believe he is so little he can ride a ladybug through the grass.
content.title: A Ladybug Safari

content.description: O is happy to play with a kite, but mad that he can't get it to fly. Uncle X helps him know that people often have mixed feelings. There's even a name for that feeling - feeling ambivalent. The friends keep trying and working together and when their kite flies they all feel happy.
content.short_description: O is happy to play with a kite, but mad that he can't get it to fly.
content.title: Flying a Kite

content.description: This song helps children know that sometimes we have two feelings at the same time and that's okay. Happy to play with a friends, but sad that mom has to go, excited to fly a kite, but frustrated when it was hard to make it fly.
content.short_description: Sometimes we have two feelings at the same time and that's okay song.
content.title: Having Mixed Feelings Song

content.description: There's so much to see at the Neighborhood carnival. Daniel is so excited to go on the ferris wheel, but he has mixed feelings. He's exicted, but it's really big and he's too afraid to try. His mom helps him know that it's okay to have mixed feelings. Did you ever feel scared about something you were excited to do?
content.short_description: Daniel is so excited to go on the ferris wheel, but he's too afraid to try.
content.title: Riding a Ferris Wheel

content.description: Daniel and Prince Wednesday are playing the carnival ring toss game. It's lots of fun, but it's frustrating too, because it's hard to do.  Sometimes it's hard to keep trying when something is hard to do.
content.short_description: It's fun but it's also frustrating for Daniel to play the ring toss game.
content.title: The Ring Toss Game

content.description: Daniel feels ready to go on the ferris wheel. He's still excited, and still  a little bit scared.  Mom, Dan and Katerina ride high above the whole neighborhood. It's so exciting to see everything from high atop the ferris wheel. Daniel is happy he finally felt ready to ride the ferris wheel.
content.short_description: Daniel feels ready to go on the ferris wheel. He's excited and a little bit scared, too.
content.title: On the Ferris Wheel

content.description: Daniel plays the "What's missing?" game while waiting for his food to arrive at a restaurant.
content.short_description: Daniel plays the "What's missing?" game while waiting at a restaurant.
content.title: What's Missing?

content.description: Daniel makes believe that he and Tigey are in charge of a real soda fountain with lemonade for all their stuffed animal friends.
content.short_description: Daniel makes believe that he and Tigey have a real soda fountain and they sell lemonade.
content.title: A Make Believe Lemonade Store

content.description: Prince Wednesday and Daniel are giving out lemonade to the neighbors. But Daniel doesn't realize that he is making Prince Wednsday feeling left out and mad. They talk together and learn that when you are able to talk about your feelings it can help you feel better.
content.short_description: Prince Wednesday tells Daniel aboout his mad feelings at the lemonade stand.
content.title: Mad at the Lemonade Stand

content.description: A song to remind us that it helps to be able to talk about our feelings. When friends can talk and listen to one another, especially about mad feelings, that can help to work things out. And Daniel and Prince Wednesday work together to fill the last glass of lemonade.
content.short_description: A song about how talking about feelings can help friends work things out.
content.title: "Talk About Your Feelings" song

content.description: Daniel and Miss Elaina are playing a splashing game in the water at the beach. It's fun at first, but then it's too much splashing for Miss Elaina. Dad Tiger teaches Miss Elaina a song that helps her talk with Daniel about  about how she is feeling.
content.short_description: Daniel and Miss Elaina are playing at the beach. But there's too much splashing.
content.title: Too Much Splashing at the Beach

content.description: Daniel makes believe he is in a submarine exploring the ocean floor. There are fish and scho, seahorses , coral reefs and even a dolphin.
content.short_description: Daniel makes believe he can travel in a submarine to see what's on the ocean floor.
content.title: Daniel's Yellow Submarine

content.description: There are important rules that help to keep us safe. Dad Tiger gets angry when Daniel and Miss Elaina don't follow them. They forgot the beach rules about asking before they go in the water.
content.short_description: Dad Tiger is angry when Daniel and Miss Elaina don't follow the beach safety rules.
content.title: Dad Tiger Gets Angry

content.description: A song about some of the many different ways you can get your mad feelings out.  You can talk it out, stomp it out , or squeeze it out. It helps to say "I'm mad!"
content.short_description: A song about some of the many different ways you can get your mad feelings out.
content.title: "You Can Get Your Mad Out" song

content.description: It's a special day as the Tiger family gets ready for their trip to visit Grandpere. They sing as they pack. Daniel puts his special things in his backpack. Then they are all ready and Trolley is too, and they are on their way!
content.short_description: The Tiger family sings as they pack for their trip. Then onto Trolley and on their way!
content.title: "The Tiger Family Trip" Song

content.description: There are so many things to see and do on the way. There's a place to go potty and a dinosaur slide to play on. But then it's time to stop playing and back on the Trolley to Grandpere's house.
content.short_description: On the way there's a dinosaur slide to play on and even a place to go to the potty.
content.title: So Many Things to Do and See

content.description: It can seem like it takes a long time to get to Grandpere's. Daniel and Margaret play a game while they wait. But when Margaret wants to keep playing, Daniel gets angry with his sister. His mom helps him to calm down and they find a way to work it out.
content.short_description: Daniel gets angry with Margaret when she doesn't want to stop playing on the Trolley.
content.title: Are We There Yet?

content.description: The Tiger Family is excited to get to Grandpere's house. But Daniel is disappointed that he can't find the special picture he made. He gives Grandpere a great big hug instead.
content.short_description: The Tiger Family is excited to arrive.  Daniel gives Grandpere a great big hug.
content.title: We Arrive at Grandpere's House!

content.description: The Tiger Family gathers around the campfire and sings a song to celebrate their happy family. It feels so good to be together.
content.short_description: The Tiger Family celebrates being together with a song around the campfire.
content.title: "All of Us Together" Song

content.description: Ethan and his Mom and Dad are going on a family trip. A trip is a great way to spend time with your family. They pack up the car and are on their way. On the way, Ethan draws pictures and looks out the window. Finally they arrive at a cabin in the woods.
content.short_description: Ethan and his parents are going on a family trip. They pack up their bags and off they go!
content.title: Ethan's Family Trip

content.description: Daniel and his family are at Grandpere's house. Daniel finds that when he's someplace new, there are some things that are different, but there are some things that are the same. His clothes aren't in the drawer, they are in a suitcase, but there's his red sweater, and there's Tigey, too.
content.short_description: Daniel finds that some things are different at Grandpere's, but some things are the same.
content.title: Morning at Grandpere's

content.description: Daniel makes believe he lives in a house on the top of a tree, on his own island, in the middle of the sea. It's so much fun to imagine he has everything he could ever need there.
content.short_description: Daniel makes believe he lives in a house on the top of a tree in the middle of the sea.
content.title: A Make Believe Tree House

content.description: A song about being away and seeing new places. Here's a game to play - find what's different and what's the same.  When Daniel goes to visit Grandpere there is so much that's different, but there are lots of things that are the same, too.
content.short_description: A song about playing a game to find out finding what's different and what's the same.
content.title: "What's Different and What's the Same" Song

content.description: Ethan and his family are on a camping trip at a cabin in the woods. There are beds, and a bathroom and a place to have a picnic dinner.  Ethan finds that when you go on a trip there are some things that are the same as they are at home, and there are some things that are different.
content.short_description: Ethan and his family are on a camping trip at a cabin in the woods.
content.title: Ethan's Camping Trip

content.description: Daniel and Grandpere wake up early so they can watch the sunrise together. They take a ride on Grandpere's boat to one of his favorite places where they see a waterfall and watch the sunrise. Daniel even gets to help steer the boat.
content.short_description: Daniel is at Grandpere's house. They wake up early to see the sunrise together.
content.title: A Boat Ride with Grandpere

content.description: Ethan and his family explore the woods because there's so much to see. They even get to see a waterfall! Then it's time to pack up their things and go home. Going on a trip can be exciting, but going home feels good, too.
content.short_description: After a day exploring the woods and seeing a waterfall, it's time for Ethan to go home.
content.title: Ethan Goes Home

content.description: The Tiger Family returns to the neighborhood and "home sweet home." Daniel says hi to his fish and is happy to be back in his own bed. He's glad to be home, even though he misses being with Grandpere.
content.short_description: Daniel feels happy to be back home again, even though he misses Grandpere.
content.title: We're Back Home!

content.description: Daniel and O can't play outside because it's raining. Together, they make a plan for their inside play - a pretend Trolley adventure. It helps when they make a map so they know where to go. First to the pretend garden, then to the pretend beach. Together they made a plan and figured it out.
content.short_description: Daniel and O have to make a plan for their indoor pretend play.
content.title: It's Too Wet To Play

content.description: If there's a problem it helps to talk about it and make a plan, whether watering a plant, building with blocks, making a picnic, or helping mom make a cake. When friends work together they can make a plan and figure things out.
content.short_description: If there's a problem it helps to talk about it and make a plan.
