content.title: "Let's Make a Plan" Song

content.description: Daniel makes believe he has a giant, flying dragon pal to play with. Together they fly around the neighborhood and have lots of fun together.  That's what makes make believe so much fun. You can imagine anything.
content.short_description: Daniel makes believe he has a dragon pal to play with!
content.title: Daniel's Dragon Pal

content.description: Daniel, Miss Elaina, and O the Owl want to make a puppet show together, but they each have their own ideas about what the story will be. Together they make a plan and figure out what each of their characters will do in the play. It's a silly story, but they figured it out together!
content.short_description: Daniel and his friends make a plan to figure out the story of their puppet show.
content.title: The Puppet Show

content.description: Ryan is at the library where she learns how to make a special kind of bird puppet. She uses colored paper to cover the bird shape by "ripping strips and dipping fingertips" - ripping strips of paper and dipping her fingertips in the paste solution. She learns a new way to make art.
content.short_description: Ryan is at the library where she learns how to make a puppet.
content.title: Ryan Makes a Puppet

content.description: Daniel makes believe that he and Margaret are dancers in a fancy dance show. They tap and twirl and jump and wiggle their tails in their sparkly red costumes. It more fun when they dance together two by two!
content.short_description: Daniel makes believe that he and Margaret are dancers in a real dance show.
content.title: The Daniel and Margaret Dance Show

content.description: Daniel and Margaret are playing school. Daniel likes pretending to be the teacher, but when Margaret doesn't want to sit still, Daniel wants Mom to help him. Mom helps him know that he is old enough and big enough to figure out what to do himself.
content.short_description: Daniel and Margaret are playing school, but Margaret isn't old enough to sit still.
content.title: Playing School with Margaret

content.description: A song about how, now that Daniel is bigger, he is able to think about what to do himself when there's a problem. He doesn't always need to ask a grownup to figure it out for him.
content.short_description: Now that Daniel is bigger, he can think of what to do himself when there's a problem.
content.title: Big Enough to Think of What to Do Song

content.description: The sisters want to put on a show for Mom but both want to wear the same dress-up clothes. They want Mom to help them but they are big enough to figure out what to do themselves. They takes turns and have fun putting on a special show for their mom.
content.short_description: The sisters want to put on a show for Mom but both want to wear the same dress up clothes.
content.title: Hazel and Phoenix Play Dress Up

content.description: Daniel goes to the Castle to play with Prince Wednesday and Chrissie. But what to do when Chrissie wants to make a Treasure Hunt and Wednesday wants to play dinosaurs? Queen Sara helps the children know that there are some problems they are big enough to solve themselves. And that's just what they do.
content.short_description: Chrissie wants to play Treasure Hunt, Wednesday wants to play dinosaurs. What to do?
content.title: We Can Take Turns

content.description: When Daniel tries a peach for the first time, he learns he is allergic to the fruit. Dad and Doctor Anna take care of him, and Doctor Anna tells Daniel how he can take care of himself, too./Daniel is celebrating the 100th day at school. He tells Teacher Harriet and his friends that he is allergic to peaches. His friends help him avoid the fruit and take care of each other.
content.short_description: Daniel is allergic to peaches./Daniel celebrates his 100th day at school.
content.title: Daniel's Allergy/Allergies at School

content.description: Jodi is nervous on her first day at school, so Teacher Harriet explains that she can find something she knows to help herself feel better. She spots Daniel Tiger, someone she knows! Daniel takes on the duties of “First Day Friend” to help Jodi feel comfortable. / Daniel goes to Jodi’s house after school and looks for things he knows (like blueberries!) to help himself feel better in a new place.
content.short_description: Jodi is nervous on her first day at school. / Daniel goes to Jodi’s house after school.
content.title: Jodi's First Day at School/Daniel Plays at Jodi's House

content.description: Daniel and Prince Wednesday discover a small lizard in Daniel's backyard. They have a lot of questions about the lizard. When they wonder and explore, they learn so many new things./Daniel and his friends learn more about their favorite Neighborhood Trolley!
content.short_description: Daniel and Prince Wednesday discover a small lizard/Daniel learns more about Trolley.
content.title: Daniel Learns About Lizards/Daniel Wonders About Trolley

content.description: Daniel's Babysitter: When Mom and Dad Tiger go out for the evening, Prince Tuesday comes to babysit. When Daniel misses his parents, Prince Tuesday reminds him that they will be back soon.    Daniel Goes to School: Daniel doesn’t want his Dad to leave him at school, but Dad Tiger reminds him that "grownups come back."  The flies by while the kids help Miss Elaina find her missing locket.
content.short_description: Prince Tuesday babysits for Daniel./Daniel doesn't want Dad Tiger to leave him at school.
content.title: Daniel's Babysitter/Daniel Goes to School
